articles.title: Luis Matos’ first career home run leads SF Giants over D-backs, Merrill Kelly - The Mercury News
articles.description: Improving to 44-33, the Giants are further above .500 than at any point during the 2022 season, with Luis Matos providing the fireworks Saturday.
articles.content:
SAN FRANCISCO In his first week and a half in the majors, Luis Matos had just about done it all. But the Giants’ 21-year-old rookie was still seeking his first career home run.

articles.title: Royals finally win a Jordan Lyles start, defeat Rays 9-4 - Royals Review
articles.description: Freddy Fermin and Edward Olivares pace the offense.
articles.content:
After 15 tries, the Royals finally won a game started by Jordan Lyles, defeating the Tampa Bay Rays 9-4 on Saturday afternoon, giving him his first win of the year.

articles.title: Pirates rally in ninth inning to beat Marlins - MLB.com
articles.description:
MIAMI -- What a difference a night makes.
The Pirates finally ended their long losing streak Friday, rallying for three runs in the top of the ninth to beat the Marlins, 3-1, at loanDepot park.
How did the Pirates celebrate the end of this 10-game skid, as th…
